newsitem.title: HONG KONG: HK CPI (A) rises annual 5.2 pct in April.
newsitem.headline: HK CPI (A) rises annual 5.2 pct in April.

text.p: The Census and Statistics Department released the following consumer price index data on Thursday showing Hong Kong's CPI (A) rose 5.2 percent in April year-on-year.
CPI (A), Hong Kong's broadest measure of inflation, is based on the 50 percent of households spending between HK$4,000 and HK$15,999 a month as of the fiscal 1994/95 base year.
CPI (B) is based on the 30 percent of households which spend HK$16,000 to HK$29,999 a month as of the 1994/95 fiscal year base.
Hang Seng CPI Apr '97 Mar '96 Apr '96
The Hang Seng CPI, published by the Hang Seng Bank Ltd, is based on the 10 percent of households spending HK$30,000 to HK$59,999 as of the 1994/95 fiscal year base.
The composite CPI is based on the combined expenditure pattern of households covered by the three CPI's.
